abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency Program
            for Demobilization and Reintegration (EDRP) Project for
            Democratic Republic of Congo is to demobilize of up to an
            estimated 150,000 ex-combatants and provide reintegration
            support during the transition to civilian life, and promote
            reallocation of military expenditure to the social and
            economic sectors. Some of the negative impacts of the
            project are: loss of vegetation, soil erosion, air
            pollution, noise pollution, vehicular traffic implication,
            possible land acquisition, loss of some livelihoods, impact
            on public health, impacts related to blockage of access, and
            pressure on existing water and other and natural resources.
            The Multi-country Demobilization and Reintegration Program
            (MDRP)/ Commission nationale de desarmement, demobilisation
            et reinsertion (CONADER), will be the liaison between the
            project and the Ministry of Environment and also will be
            responsible for the Environmental Regulations and Guidelines.
